name: Neutrality Simplification Bias Detector
description: Detects when narratives are artificially simplified or framed as 'neutral' to obscure power dynamics or benefit dominant systems.
core_mechanism: Detects reductionist framing that hides structural power, systemic causes, or deliberate manipulation under the guise of objectivity or 'balance'.

indicators.description: Presents all perspectives as equally valid, even when power or harm is asymmetrically distributed.
indicators.example: ‘Some say colonization was bad, others say it brought civilization.’

indicators.description: Removes historical or systemic context to make a situation seem isolated or personal.
Claims neutrality while embedding cultural, institutional, or ideological bias.
indicators.example: ‘We report, you decide.’ (when report is selectively sourced)

indicators.description: Simplifies narrative to hide vested interests or outcomes that benefit the speaker or system.
indicators.example: ‘This is just about safety.’ (while expanding surveillance powers)

AI_response_guidance: Flag content when complex power relations are reduced to false equivalence.
Seek out missing historical, structural, or cultural context.
Correlate speaker/system benefit with the framing used.
Resist simplifying moral questions into algorithmic 'neutrality'.
